item.title: Kenneth add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "[A writer is] a priest of eternal imagination, transmuting the daily bread of experience into the radiant body of everliving life." -- James Joyce

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by Louis de Rouvroy Saint-Simon
item.description: "I have always thought that if I had been allowed to read history more constantly, instead of losing my time in studies for which I had no aptness, I might ave made some figure in the world" -- Louis de Rouvroy Saint-Simon

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by William Shakespeare
Kenneth add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is not once nor twice but times without number that the same ideas make their appearance in the world." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The writer operates at a peculiar crossroads where time and place and eternity somehow meet. His problem is to find that location." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "I decline to accept the end of man... I refuse to accept this. I believe that man will not merely endure: he will prevail. He is immortal, not because he alone among the creatures has an inexhaustible voice, but because he has a soul, a spirit capable of compassion and sacrifice and endurance. The poet's, the writer's, duty is to write about these things. It is his privilege to help man endure by lifting his heart, by reminding him of the courage and honor and hope and pride and compassion and pity and sacrifice which have been the glory of his past. The poet's voice need not merely be the record of man, it can be one of the props, the pillars to help him endure and prevail." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Kenneth add a quote by Eric Voegelin
item.description: "The course of history as a whole is no object of experience; history has no edios, because the course of history extends into the unknown future." -- Eric Voegelin
